TopicTitle: [Linux] NRE when getting close (~2km) to stranded kerbal on a rescue mission

Articles.Content:
hi,

when i try to rescue a stranded kerbal KSP crashes:

Player.log error msg:

NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object

at Part.force_activate () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

at Part+ .MoveNext () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

this happens when i close in on the kerbal and get as close as ~2km

im on linux mint 17 64bit, 8GB RAM, KSP (no mods) via STEAM, dont know if it runs 32bit or 64bit executable but crash also happened with 0.24.? on an earlier old 32bit ubuntu install with same msg.

back then i reproduced the crash several times, even tried to replace the kerbal with an capsule (by editing save) which didnt crash KSP if i remember correctly.

in deleted bug forum there were at least 2 threads with similar issues:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/88337-Crash-to-desktop-when-a-certain-distance-from-stranded-Kerbal

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/87609-2-km-range-issues

but since i cannot access these anymore, here a new post, hoping squad will find what causes these (and some other) NREs so i will be able to rescue my first kerbal from orbit in 0.25.x or 0.26

bye

player_K

hm. after playing with mods, ksp wouldnt start anymore (crash at load screen). so i tried to manually start the 64bit binary. then it loaded fine and mods were working. steam was starting the 32bit bin (as explained in the linux thread).

so i removed all mods, changed steam to start 64bit, loaded a save where i could accept a rescue contract, got to orbit, close intersect, target retroburn, approaching... wait... oh... 400m distance... nice, didnt crash, got closer, changed to Jenrick, stuffed him in lander can. fine. but what if it would have worked in 32bit too this time?

load a quicksave, flyby jenrick this time, go to 3km dist and quicksave again. reapproach with 64bit to reeeaally be sure it doesnt crash when dist goes to 2.2/2.3km. all fine.

quit game, start 32bit, load save, go to fly my rescue ship. on load KSP instantly crashed again with 'force_activate' NRE.

so i guess instead of linux KSP 64bit beeing 'as stable' as 32bit, on my system it runs even better.

glad i decided to install mint 64bit instead of 32bit with pae kernel again.
